dcterms:creator: S. Guo
T. Delbruck
dcterms:description: The driving dataset from DND21 was created by converting a simulated video (scenes captured from the dashboard camera of a car driving through a city) to event data using the Video to Events (v2e) tool. It has a length of ≈ 6 seconds and contains ≈ 3.9 M events, representing a moving camera application of DVS.
dcterms:title: Driving dataset

dcterms:creator: S. Guo
T. Delbruck
dcterms:description: The hotel-bar dataset from DND21 represents a typical surveillance operation using a stationary DVS camera, created by recording scenes from a hotel lobby using a DAVIS346 event camera. It has a length of approximately 6.2 seconds and contains 614 K events.
dcterms:title: Hotel-bar dataset

dcterms:description: The NUS traffic dataset represents a stationary surveillance camera operation, acquired using a DAVIS240 event camera placed at a traffic junction, monitoring various objects moving on the road. It includes GT boxes manually drawn around objects of interest.
dcterms:title: NUS Traffic dataset
